intro: Scabiosa arenaria, commonly known as the sand scabious, is a flowering plant native to arid and coastal regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its basal rosette of gray-green, hairy leaves and produces clusters of pink or purple flowers with five petals. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well adapted to harsh, dry environments. Its flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance. Scabiosa arenaria is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
